alert.note: Alert for Morton; Stevens (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:49PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Morton and southern Stevens Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 548 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hough, or 14 miles southeast of Wilburton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Feterita and Hugoton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southwestern Kansas.
